name: Fayaz Ahmad Sardar
summary: Experienced Agriculture Advisor and Language Officer with a B.Sc. in Agriculture (Nangarhar University, 2002) and extensive work with Afghan government and international organizations (PRT/ADT, IPCB-S, BRAC). Skilled in agriculture development, capacity building, program planning, data collection, stakeholder coordination, and training. Proficient in English, Pashto, and Dari; fluent in document translation and simultaneous interpretation; strong field experience across districts and provinces.

experience.title: Language Officer
experience.company: IPCB-S (International Police Coordination Board Kabul, Afghanistan)
experience.description: Performed translations from English to Pashto/Dari; conducted simultaneous translations in IPCB-S meetings; undertook tasks as required by the Head of IPCB-S.

experience.title: Agriculture Advisor and Language Officer
experience.description: Established and maintained coordination with governmental and non-government organizations; worked on strategic planning with DAIL Office; assisted DAIL staff for annual planning; prepared training materials; translated agriculture guidelines; trained Nangarhar University agriculture faculty and staff; supported needs assessments and staff trainings.

experience.title: Provincial Manager
experience.description: Prepared and implemented annual work plans; supervised staff and schooling activities; developed female staff; built capacity and ensured reporting to central office; coordinated with provincial offices to enhance project activities.

experience.title: Plant Protection Manager
experience.description: Provided improved seed to farmers; worked with farmers to control plant disease; delivered refresh courses; recorded plant disease reports; managed state agriculture properties.
